title: Mission Description
content: Survivors are often called "unfortunate." It was because she lost her life due to theLord Ravagerthatthe geniuswas able to reverse her death... The past is in the past. Perhaps it is best to look towards the future.Take a rest and discuss the plan from here with the others.

speaker: March 7th
line: Are... Are you alright?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Did I pass out?

text: It's okay. You didn't end up in Dreamflux Reef .
We were just about to make a memorial portrait of you.

children.speaker: Wonweek
children.line: A little quick to the draw, aren't you?

speaker: Sunday
line: The tuning rebounded and affected Wonweek instead. This is no ordinary woman.

speaker: Welt
line: I suppose there's no point in hiding it from you anymore.

speaker: Welt
line: Miss Tingyun is originally from the Xianzhou . She had an unfortunate encounter with a Lord Ravager, who robbed her of her identity and left her on the verge of death. While she miraculously escaped with her life, her body suffered terrible injuries, beyond all power to heal.

speaker: Sunday
line: But something happened to change that outcome?

speaker: Welt
line: Yes, a genius got involved. She's very accomplished in the field of life sciences and managed to grant Miss Tingyun a shot at survival.

speaker: Welt
line: After that, she asked the Express to escort Miss Tingyun back home. We made a stop at Penacony along the way, partly to allow her some time to convalesce.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I'm so sorry. I thought no one would be affected if I hid inside a dream. I didn't expect so many mishaps to happen.

speaker: Wonweek
line: That's alright, so long as nobody was hurt. Can I get something to drink? I feel like I've been asleep for ten years.

speaker: Welt
line: That's fine. We should find another place to talk anyway. We drew some attention with that commotion earlier.

speaker: Wonweek
line: SoulGlad again... I'm a local, you know.

speaker: Sunday
line: You'll have to make do.

speaker: Welt
line: In any case, I must thank the both of you for your assistance.

speaker: Sunday
line: It was nothing. Now that the matter with Miss Tingyun is resolved, are we meeting your other two companions next?

speaker: Welt
line: There's no need for that. Mr. Wonweek is in poor condition, so let's wrap up your farewells first.

speaker: Welt
line: I'll leave Miss Tingyun in your hands.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? But Mr. Yang, the messenger from the Xianzhou is almost here. You're not coming with us?

speaker: Welt
line: I trust that you can handle it. Besides, Himeko will be there. She'll be able to handle any decisions should you run into any difficulties.

speaker: March 7th
line: Okay. We better hurry then.

text: Discuss the next steps with the others

title: Step Description
content: You are about to return to the Xianzhou, but you still haven't decided on a souvenir for your old friends. You have decided to give it your all and get something that will make Miss Tingyun shine in the eyes of others.Go to Oti Mall with Tingyun to buy gifts.

speaker: Welt
line: Where are you planning to go next?

speaker: Sunday
line: Could you give me some time to think about it?

speaker: March 7th
line: Shall we keep going, then?

text: What are we doing here again?

speaker: March 7th
line: Did you forget already? Miss Tingyun is going back to the Alliance , so we're here to help her pick out souvenirs.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I'm not too familiar with this planet. I'm worried an unscrupulous cutthroat merchant will try to take advantage of me. Luckily, the people I want to buy these gifts for are friends you already know on the Xianzhou, so I'll be counting on both your stakeholder intuitions for recommendations!

speaker: March 7th
line: As if a merchant could seriously take advantage of you...

speaker: Tingyun
line: I already picked up a few gifts earlier, so that means there's only three more left to go. But we've already lost a lot of time, so we'd better not drag our feet...

speaker: Shop Assistant
line: Welcome! How can I help you?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Hello there! It's my first time visiting the Dreamscape , so I wanted to buy some local specialties as souvenirs for my friends back home. My two friends here are more familiar with the Dreamscape and recommended your shop, so I'm here to take a look.

speaker: Shop Assistant
line: Why, you really know how to flatter! Go ahead—browse all you like.

speaker: Tingyun
line: First, we have Lady Fu Xuan of the Divination Commission . What do you think best suits her?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Lady Fu Xuan has such refined taste? The Xianzhou really has changed a lot in the time I've been asleep.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Let's go with your suggestion.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Uhm, did you pick that because of her third eye?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: A meticulously thought out and interesting suggestion. It'll make for a novel gift. Let's go with that.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Um, can you picture her driving?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: It looks cool, but it's probably not a good idea.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Next is General Jing Yuan .

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That's not your decision to make!

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: That's the kind of treasure I've always yearned for, but the general's position won't allow him to accept such a gift.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: "Come to Clock Studios Theme Park to learn more about the history of the Planet of Festivities!" I think the general will like this gift.

text: Send him a division of elite fighters.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Seriously?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Now that the Alliance has all of you there to help them, sending any elite fighters more would just be overkill.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Finally, we have Lady Bailu of the Alchemy Commission . She loves excitement.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: That's a good idea. It might be commonplace, but it's still the specialty of Penacony. It would make for an ideal gift to bring home.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: You carry yourself with such dignity and grace, but you still have the heart of a child. Lady Bailu loves these types of accessories. Let's go with your suggestion.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Both wings and horns? That's a little much, don't you think?

speaker: Tingyun
line: That's all of them. Please wrap them up for me.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Thanks to both your help, everything went smoother than I expected. And it looks like we still have some time to spare.

speaker: March 7th
line: Why don't we pay another visit to the Dreamscape Sales Store ? You can find memory bubbles pretty much anywhere, but Penacony's dream bubbles are extraordinary. Even if we don't get them as gifts, we can keep them as souvenirs for ourselves.

speaker: Tingyun
line: A souvenir for myself? That's definitely an idea I can get behind.

speaker: Tingyun
line: But there's one more thing I wish to do. Since this is our last stop, could I have a word with you two in private? Perhaps somewhere more secluded. I'd like to discuss a personal matter.

title: Step Description
content: Though you have spent a great time together, it seems Tingyun has something to discuss with you as farewell creeps near.Go for a good old walk-and-talk.

speaker: Tingyun
line: This is a good spot.

speaker: March 7th
line: Miss Tingyun, what's this about?

speaker: Tingyun
line: You've looked out for me during our travels together these past few days. I'm truly grateful and can't thank you enough.

speaker: Tingyun
line: But there are some things I find difficult to forget. I feel it's only right that I tell you what's on my mind before we part ways.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Do you two still remember what it was like when you first saw me?

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ How could we forget? ( Trailblazer ) was so shocked, ( he / she ) was frozen in place when ( he / she ) shouted...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Exactly.

speaker: Tingyun
line: And that's precisely why I haven't been able to shake off this strange feeling in the days since I started traveling with you.

speaker: Tingyun
line: When I asked for your names, I couldn't help but think that this "first encounter" was actually a "long-awaited reunion" for you.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I've heard about what happened to you on the Xianzhou, and I've got to admit, that Phantylia's disguise was so perfect, it was like another me tricking everyone.

speaker: March 7th
line: Yeah, we couldn't even tell when you were replaced by Phantylia.

speaker: March 7th
line: I figured it happened when we were after Kafka . You vanished for a while, I thought you must have come back as a double.

speaker: Tingyun
line: But it was much earlier than that.

speaker: Tingyun
line: That thought has filled me with sorrow, as if a piece of my life had been stolen away, and I had no part in it.

speaker: Tingyun
line: That's what I've been puzzled about too. I never actually saw how Phantylia managed to disguise herself as me.

speaker: Tingyun
line: What was your impression of that "Tingyun," if you recall?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: That's just the nature of the foxians . It's widely known that mystery is the key to our allure.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: But I'm not very strong physically. Are you referring to my quick wits?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: That part is true. I'm always calculating when it comes to business, but never with people.

speaker: Tingyun
line: So, what did she seem like to you?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: I'll just assume that's a compliment! Maybe next time, you could just say "silver-tongued."

text: A potential Emanator of the Destruction .

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Is that... a compliment? I'm not sure if I'm deserving of that title.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Was there anything particularly memorable?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That's true! I'd love to learn how you do it!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Now's not the time for those kinds of jokes...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey! No tattling!

speaker: Tingyun
line: Now, the final question.

speaker: Tingyun
line: In your eyes, am I just like the Tingyun you remember?

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait — don't you find that question a bit weird? You're the real Tingyun. Why compare yourself to an imposter?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Miss March, you might have the wrong idea. I'm just feeling a mix of regret and relief.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Tingyun
line: As a merchant, staying well-informed is crucial. It's only natural for me to stay updated on the events of the Luofu before I return.

speaker: Tingyun
line: If I had rushed in and out back then, I wouldn't have been much help. Instead, I would've postponed the trip and sought assistance from allies, but in that case...

speaker: March 7th
line: We wouldn't have crossed paths.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Exactly.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Based on your description, that Lord Ravager was indeed cunning. Her demeanor mirrored mine so closely that it felt like she was living my life for a few days rather than merely disguising herself.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I regret missing out on your Xianzhou journey, but everything that unfolded afterward, aside from the scheming, played out exactly as if I'd been there. This leads me to consider another possibility...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Phantylia had stolen a piece of my life, and a foxian always gets even. I will not be taken advantage of. I must take something back from her as well.

speaker: Tingyun
line: But after thinking it over, the only thing that could be considered equal value... is the bond I have with all of you.

speaker: Tingyun
line: That thought has brought me great comfort, and now I know how to speak to you properly.

speaker: Tingyun
line: We've never even met before, yet here you are, offering your help, just as before. I should've treated you with respect, but fear of Phantylia made me act like somebody else.

speaker: Tingyun
line: And now, I will reclaim everything I have lost. And it should begin with a proper acknowledgment—

speaker: Tingyun
line: Dear benefactors, I extend my heartfelt gratitude to you.

text: It's time to rethink how you see yourself.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Looks like we're off to a good start! Moving forward, I'll definitely be trying more things like this from now on.

speaker: Tingyun
line: And you, my dear benefactors, will be my source of courage.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Miss Tingyun, that's way too over the top. Just don't make any risky decisions. It might overwhelm ( him / her ) !

speaker: Tingyun
line: Haha, we'll see. I just hope the Tingyun in your memories won't be tainted by Phantylia anymore.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Alright. No more questions. I hope I didn't take up too much of your time. Let's continue on our way.

text: Investigate the dream bubble at Dr. Edward's

title: Step Description
content: How can a dream be a gift? To some people, those are the most precious things they have.Go to Dr. Edward's and take a look at the dream bubble that Tingyun gifted you.

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: Welcome to the Dreamscape Sales Store! Dr. Edward at your service!

speaker: March 7th
line: We're looking for some dreams to give as gifts — something exotic and, preferably, captivating.

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: Just a friendly reminder: Being too picky won't help you find the best dreams. It'll just dampen your spirits ahead of time.

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: That being said, there are always some lucky exceptions. Not long ago, I procured a dream bubble that sounds perfect for you.

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: The story unfolds in the Xianzhou Alliance, where a young sword master strives to become the Sword Champion. However, his junior foxian soror who's just turned a hundred, puts him in a tough spot...

speaker: March 7th
line: Why does that sound oddly familiar...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Since I'm returning to the Xianzhou, I think it's better to choose something unrelated to the Alliance. Feel free to pick a few for me.

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: I love customers like you... So easy to work with.

speaker: March 7th
line: So easy to take advantage of, you mean?

speaker: March 7th
line: Just don't pick anything weird, okay?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Oh, speaking of dreamscapes, I have a gift for you, my benefactors.

speaker: Tingyun
line: After troubling you all this time, I couldn't leave without properly expressing my thanks. Here's a dream bubble for you — I hope you enjoy it.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wow, that's really nice of you!

speaker: Dr. Edward
line: Here are the dream bubbles I've prepared for you. Thank you for your business!

speaker: Tingyun
line: Well, it looks like everything's finally in order. I suppose it's time to head back?

title: Step Description
content: Though you wish it wasn't true, the time has come to bid farewell to Miss Tingyun... This is not a reunion, but maybe that is not such a bad thing. When a reunion is so perfect, it gives you something to look forward to in the future.Go to Radiant Feldspar and meet up with Himeko.

speaker: March 7th
line: I can't believe it's time for Miss Tingyun to leave. I'm not ready to say goodbye just yet.

speaker: Himeko
line: You're back!

speaker: March 7th
line: Yeah, we got delayed on the way. Mr. Yang will explain in detail when he gets back.

speaker: March 7th
line: Has the messenger from the Xianzhou arrived yet?

speaker: Himeko
line: Yes, we've been chatting for a while. Turns out, she's an old acquaintance of yours.

speaker: Yukong
line: Long time no see, everyone.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Madam Yukong?

speaker: Yukong
line: I've imagined this moment many times.

speaker: Yukong
line: I was worried I might embarrass myself in front of you. I even rehearsed every word beforehand.

speaker: Yukong
line: But now it seems it was unnecessary.

speaker: Yukong
line: Tingyun, I'm here to take you home.

speaker: Himeko
line: You two must have a lot to catch up on after being apart for so long. We'll give you some space.

title: Step Description
content: Like everyone else, they are speaking about the past... That's not to say they have nothing to discuss except the past. It's just that they want to use it to explain how they will move towards the future.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Madam Yukong, I wasn't expecting it to be you. What a wonderful surprise!

speaker: Yukong
line: I wanted to come because... after all, it's you who's coming home.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Yeah, me, of all people...

speaker: Yukong
line: Your body... It's going to be tough from now on, isn't it?

speaker: Tingyun
line: I've already escaped death once. What more could I ask for?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Also, it's not all bad. I might even beat you at arm wrestling now.

speaker: Yukong
line: You're still the same — carefree as always.

speaker: Yukong
line: I have a lot I'd like to tell you, but I'll save it for the road. It's a long journey back to the Luofu.

speaker: Yukong
line: Even if we can't completely rid you of the pain, there must be ways to alleviate it on the Xianzhou.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I have no doubt. But... since we're alone here, may I ask you one more thing?

speaker: Tingyun
line: ...Do I really have to go back to the Luofu?

speaker: Yukong
line: ...Why? You don't want to?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Despite Phantylia's ruthlessness, she spared me when I should have been eliminated. And why did Miss Ruan Mei , who has no ties to the Xianzhou, go out of her way to save me?

speaker: Tingyun
line: It seems as if I've become a pawn in someone else's game.

speaker: Yukong
line: ...There are people within the Alliance who also believe that the suspect is now on the Yuque .

speaker: Tingyun
line: If that's the case, it's all the more reason for me not to return to the Luofu and complicate things. I might as well take advantage of this situation.

speaker: Yukong
line: Take advantage of the situation? What do you mean?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Right now, the marks of Ruin inside me maintain a delicate balance. Moreover... they were created by Phantylia herself.

speaker: Tingyun
line: If possible, please inform the general and arrange for me to meet with the marshal . Maybe this body of mine can help the Alliance get one step closer to the Xianzhou's enemies.

speaker: Yukong
line: When Ruan Mei visited the Luofu earlier, she mentioned what happened to you. This coincided with when the message sent by the Astral Express arrived.

speaker: Yukong
line: The Arbiter-Generals concluded that Phantylia did not intend for you to survive. If utilized strategically, this could give the Alliance an element of surprise.

speaker: Yukong
line: If we follow this plan, we must keep your "resurrection" hidden. But before making any decisions, I want to know what you think. If you wish to go home...

speaker: Yukong
line: I'll support you, no matter what others may say.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Then I'm glad. I shall save you the trouble of hearing what those people may say.

speaker: Yukong
line: The road ahead is perilous. If you decide to take it, I won't stop you. Maybe I'm being selfish, but I still want to know — are you choosing this because it's what you really want?.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I've come to see myself clearly in this dream journey. Perhaps it's what people call a blessing in disguise.

speaker: Tingyun
line: There is someone who can attest to my true intentions.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Please follow me. She should be around here somewhere.

speaker: Yukong
line: Is that...

speaker: Tingyun
line: After a strange encounter, I was fragmented into multiple "Tingyuns," each embodying a different aspect of my memories.

speaker: Tingyun
line: And one of them hasn't returned to me because she ventured too far. Until now.

speaker: Yukong
line: ...You mean her?

speaker: Yukong
line: What is she... doing?

speaker: Tingyun
line: She is captivated by something that has deeply mesmerized me.

speaker: Tingyun
line: As a fleeting emotion, she's no different from a newborn. Her boarding this ship was solely down to her inner impulse.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Madam Yukong, do you remember? Perhaps that was just an ordinary flight for you. But for a certain child...

speaker: Tingyun
line: That was her first experience with the "sky."

speaker: Yukong
line: Of course I remember.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Reality is But Dream's Echo.mp4

speaker: Yukong
line: Back then, you were still young enough for me to carry.

speaker: Tingyun
line: You probably still can! Want to give it a try?

speaker: Yukong
line: I'm afraid you'd be too heavy for me now.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Just kidding.

speaker: Yukong
line: I remember you kept begging me to take you to the starskiff and even dreamed of becoming a pilot. But once you were airborne, you were so nervous that you clung to others for dear life.

speaker: Tingyun
line: This flight was a turning point in my life.

speaker: Tingyun
line: The boundless cosmos unfolded before me. I was completely mesmerized, not just by the view, but by a realization—

speaker: Tingyun
line: In this world, there are paths beyond waiting for us to explore.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Even though I lacked the talent to pilot the starskiff and wasn't much of a warrior, I still chose to travel around with the merchant guild.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Even to this day, this thrill still courses through me.

speaker: Yukong
line: That hasn't changed?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Never.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Now, I can embark once more on my journey as a "Traveler of No Return," exploring the paths that lie beyond.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Speaking of which, how are things with the Whistling Flames?

speaker: Yukong
line: I've left Yanming in charge for now. He's reliable, but he can be a bit extreme, and might not always follow your principles as a traveling merchant.

speaker: Tingyun
line: My principles...

speaker: Tingyun
line: "Forsake what others fight for and take what others abandon. That's the way to navigate the world and achieve my goals." I will continue to uphold my principles.

speaker: Tingyun
line: But now, I've also learned that while these merchant principles may apply to humans, they falter in the face of the gods.

speaker: Yukong
line: But this shouldn't fall on your shoulders to begin with. You are simply an innocent survivor in this war.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Madam Yukong, you were once a "survivor" in the war too, weren't you?

speaker: Tingyun
line: In a hazy dream, I vaguely remember someone telling me that the inescapable price of survival is often more adversity, but...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Madam Yukong, the gods use humans as pawns in their cosmic game, sacrificing countless innocent souls... Have you ever thought about making THEM pay?

speaker: Yukong
line: ...Every moment of every day. But as inconsequential as we are, how can we escape the fate of being mere pawns?

speaker: Yukong
line: If I could choose, I would never want you to become a pawn. I just wish you could still be that carefree little fox, not caught up in this war...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Don't be disheartened, Madam Yukong.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Thanks to the "favor" of the Lord Ravager, I've become a player in this game.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Remember, it's often the unassuming pawns — the lone traveler or the worm that subdues the dragon — that leave even the best strategists helpless.

speaker: Tingyun
line: So now, I'll become a cunning speck of dust and make those masterminds behind the curtains...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Sneeze a few times!

text: A moment of silence lingers after that. "Departure" is often indistinguishable from "Parting," yet they are fortunate enough not to have to waver between the two.
But luck never seems to favor everyone...
The ascetic still gazes back at who they used to be, and the most weighty part of that identity will finally be parted...
